com.palomamobile.android.sdk.notification

Interface INotificationManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IServiceManager<INotificationService>

    public interface INotificationManager
extends IServiceManager<INotificationService>
    Methods in this interface provide convenient job creation methods that provide easy access to the underlying INotificationService functionality. App developers can either use BaseRetryPolicyAwareJob job instances returned by the createJob...() methods, or create custom jobs that invoke methods of the INotificationService returned by IServiceManager.getService()
    To get a concrete implementation of this interface call ServiceSupport.Instance.getServiceManager(INotificationManager.class)

      • Methods inherited from interface com.palomamobile.android.sdk.core.IServiceManager

        getService

    • Method Detail

      • createJobPostEchoNotification

        JobPostEchoNotification createJobPostEchoNotification(Notification echo)
        Normally notifications are only received on the client as a result of some action taking place on the server (eg. message received, friend found etc.). This method exists solely to provide the ability to test Notifications on their own without the need for additional triggers. This asynchronous method will ask the server to return the provided echo notification via the configured channel (GCM, SMS, etc.).
        When the request to send notification is posted to server an EventEchoNotificationRequested is published on the de.greenrobot.event.EventBus as returned by ServiceSupport.getEventBus().
        When a notification is received EventNotificationReceived is published on the de.greenrobot.event.EventBus as returned by ServiceSupport.getEventBus().
        Parameters:
        echo - notification sent to the server to be received back via a notification channel
